titleStmt.title: Certayne fautes which at the fyrst sight might stay the reader, are these: The fyrst numbre, signifieth the lease of the queyre: the seconde numbre, the syde.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Certayne fautes which at the fyrst sight might stay the reader, are these: The fyrst numbre, signifieth the lease of the queyre: the seconde numbre, the syde.

monogr.title: A postill or collection of moste godly doctrine vpon every gospell through the yeare : as well for holye dayes as Sondayes, dygested in suche order, as they bee appoynted and set forthe in the booke of Common Prayer. Uerye profytable for all curates, parentes, maysters of housholdes, and other gouerners of youth
monogr.author: Corvinus, Antonius

div.head: Certayne fautes which at the fyrst sight might stay the reader, are these: The fyrst numbre, signifieth the lease of the queyre: the seconde numbre, the syde.
div.p: b. 1. the second syde, for mothes, reade mouthes. b. 2. facie. 1. what shall signes, what signes shal. b. 3. fac. 1. doth loke his mayster, loke for his maister. c. 2 fac, 2. then so, then to. c. 5 fa. 1. folish folishnes, folio eodem, mystery, ministery. d. 2. 1. a mes, armes. d 3. 1 he aith, he saith. e. 1. did long, did not longe. e. 8. 1. inogh, ynough. f. 3. 2 our neceues, our necessaries. f. 4. 1. this is place, this place it is. f. 5. 1. and wag battail, and wage battail. eodem, shall say, shal heare. f. 6. 2. satisfaction, sanctificacion. g. 1. 2. so much, adde, so much to whō it pleaseth him. g. 4. 1. faith by hearyng, faith cometh by heryng. h. 5. 1. laiyng, saying. h. 5. 2. wold worlde, k. 4. 1. doth he giue, doth he not giue. Where the gospell on Easter daye is appointed Mathew. 28. take for it Marc. 16. for the exposition is applyed to the same. o. 2. 1. whiche go, which would go, p. 2. 1. deseching, besechinge. s: 5. 2. mihtely, mightely. v. 2. 2 Christ was, Christ which was. v. 8. 1, Fentils Gentyls. x. 5. 1. hereinand, herein, and. y 4. 2. worde, worlde.
